main_definition: Million is a numerical value that represents one thousand times ten (1,000 x 10), or the quantity of items equal to one million.

meanings_and_examples.example: The city has a population of over six million people.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit in the decimal system representing 1,000,000 or one thousand thousands
meanings_and_examples.example: He won $1 million in the lottery.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to describe something as extravagant or costly
meanings_and_examples.example: The wedding reception was a lavish affair, with expenses reaching upwards of six figures per guest.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term in sports statistics referring to the total number of runs batted in (RBI) by a player
meanings_and_examples.example: In baseball, he had over 250 RBIs last season.
